title: Saving subdataset requires `-d .` ?
body:
#### What is the problem?
Maybe I am missing something. I thought `datalad save SUBDATASET` would save the latest commit of the subdataset located in folder `SUBDATASET`. But here is what happens:
```
[dorian@mri fmriprep-20.2.x]$ datalad save -m 'Update fmriprep reference' fmriprep
[dorian@mri fmriprep-20.2.x]$ datalad save -m 'Update fmriprep reference' fmriprep/
[dorian@mri fmriprep-20.2.x]$ datalad save -d . -m 'Update fmriprep reference' fmriprep
add(ok): fmriprep (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
[dorian@mri fmriprep-20.2.x]$ datalad status -r
nothing to save, working tree clean
```
I was running `datalad status -r` to make sure the entire subdataset tree was clean. It showed that the subdataset `fmriprep` was modified. I tried to save it normally, and the prompt just returns, nothing was done. Running `datalad status -r` still showed it as modified. After placing `-d .` in the command, it actually saved it. Did I miss something on how it should work?

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
NA

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
datalad 0.14.0


#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
These subdatasets were folders, thus I created the dataset with `--force`.

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
Yup.
